required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Determine Safety and Efficacy of Long-term Oral Lacosamide in Patients With Partial Seizures
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label Extension Trial to Determine Safety and Efficacy of Long-term Oral SPM 927 in Patients With Partial Seizures

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this trial is to determine whether lacosamide is safe and effective for long-term use in patients with partial-seizures from epilepsy

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting at Least 1 Treatment-Emergent Adverse Event (TEAE) During the Treatment Period (Maximum 6 Years)
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events are any untoward medical occurrences in a subject administered study treatment, whether or not these events are related to treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Prematurely Discontinuing Due to a Treatment-Emergent Adverse Event (TEAE) During the Treatment Period (Maximum 6 Years)
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events are any untoward medical occurrences in a subject administered study treatment, whether or not these events are related to treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting at Least 1 Serious Adverse Event (SAE) During the Treatment Period (Maximum 6 Years)
primary_outcome.description: Serious adverse events are any untoward serious medical occurrences in a subject administered study treatment, whether or not these events are related to treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Percentage Change From Baseline in 28-day Seizure Frequency During the Treatment Period (Maximum 6 Years)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (8-week Baseline Period from the parent study SP0754 [NCT00136019]), Treatment Period (Maximum 6 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Negative changes from Baseline indicate an improvement (i.e., a reduction) in 28-day seizure frequency.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of at Least 50 % Responders During the Treatment Period (Maximum 6 Years)
secondary_outcome.description: At least 50 percent response is based on the percentage reduction in 28-day seizure frequency during the Treatment Period of the open-label extension relative to the Baseline Phase of the prior study.

intervention.description: 50mg or 100 mg tablets, up to 800 mg/day given twice daily (BID) throughout the trial

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Completion of parent clinical trial for treatment of partial seizures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Receiving any study drug or experimental device other than lacosamide
- Meets withdrawal criteria for parent trial or experiencing ongoing serious adverse event

results_reference.citation: Husain A, Chung S, Faught E, Isojarvi J, McShea C, Doty P. Long-term safety and efficacy in patients with uncontrolled partial-onset seizures treated with adjunctive lacosamide: results from a Phase III open-label extension trial. Epilepsia. 2012 Mar;53(3):521-8. doi: 10.1111/j.1528-1167.2012.03407.x.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Other: Subject wants to become pregnant
Other: Travel to / from site difficulty
Other: Subject ran out of medication
Other: Subject had surgery for epilepsy

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting at Least 1 Treatment-Emergent Adverse Event (TEAE) During the Treatment Period (Maximum 6 Years)
outcome.description: Adverse events are any untoward medical occurrences in a subject administered study treatment, whether or not these events are related to treatment.
outcome.population: Of the 308 subjects who entered the study, 308 are included in this summary based on the Safety Set (SS). SS population: number of subjects treated.

measure.description: Adverse events are any untoward medical occurrences in a subject administered study treatment, whether or not these events are related to treatment.
measure.population: Of the 308 subjects who entered the study, 308 are included in this summary based on the Safety Set (SS). SS population: number of subjects treated.

outcome.description: Serious adverse events are any untoward serious medical occurrences in a subject administered study treatment, whether or not these events are related to treatment.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting at Least 1 Serious Adverse Event (SAE) During the Treatment Period (Maximum 6 Years)
measure.description: Serious adverse events are any untoward serious medical occurrences in a subject administered study treatment, whether or not these events are related to treatment.
measure.population: Of the 308 subjects who entered the study, 308 are included in this summary based on the Safety Set (SS). SS population: number of subjects treated.

outcome.title: Median Percentage Change From Baseline in 28-day Seizure Frequency During the Treatment Period (Maximum 6 Years)
outcome.description: Negative changes from Baseline indicate an improvement (i.e., a reduction) in 28-day seizure frequency.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (8-week Baseline Period from the parent study SP0754 [NCT00136019]), Treatment Period (Maximum 6 years)
outcome.population: Of the 308 subjects who were enrolled/treated in the study, 307 are included in this summary based on the Full Analysis Set (FAS). FAS population: number of subjects treated with at least 1 post-baseline seizure diary day with available data during the SP756 study.

measure.title: Median Percentage Change From Baseline in 28-day Seizure Frequency During the Treatment Period (Maximum 6 Years)
measure.description: Negative changes from Baseline indicate an improvement (i.e., a reduction) in 28-day seizure frequency.
measure.population: Of the 308 subjects who were enrolled/treated in the study, 307 are included in this summary based on the Full Analysis Set (FAS). FAS population: number of subjects treated with at least 1 post-baseline seizure diary day with available data during the SP756 study.

outcome.title: Percentage of at Least 50 % Responders During the Treatment Period (Maximum 6 Years)
outcome.description: At least 50 percent response is based on the percentage reduction in 28-day seizure frequency during the Treatment Period of the open-label extension relative to the Baseline Phase of the prior study.
outcome.population: Of the 308 subjects who were enrolled/treated in the study, 307 are included in this summary based on the Full Analysis Set (FAS). FAS population: number of subjects treated with at least 1 post-baseline seizure diary day with available data during the SP756 study.

measure.title: Percentage of at Least 50 % Responders During the Treatment Period (Maximum 6 Years)
measure.description: At least 50 percent response is based on the percentage reduction in 28-day seizure frequency during the Treatment Period of the open-label extension relative to the Baseline Phase of the prior study.
measure.population: Of the 308 subjects who were enrolled/treated in the study, 307 are included in this summary based on the Full Analysis Set (FAS). FAS population: number of subjects treated with at least 1 post-baseline seizure diary day with available data during the SP756 study.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: UCB has > 60 but <= 180 days to review results communications prior to public release and may delete information that is confidential and compromises ongoing studies or is considered proprietary. This restriction is not intended to compromise the objective scientific integrity of the manuscript, it being understood that the results shall be published regardless of outcome.
